question: The Bandhavgarh National Park (UNP) is located in which district of Madhya Pradesh?
explanation: The Bandhavgarh National Park (BNP) is located in the Umaria district of Madhya Pradesh and covers an area of 105 square kilometres. The park has one of the highest density of Bengal tigers known in the world, and is home to some famous named tigers which are large in size and are beautiful.
